question.para: Can I use a version newer than the one in the Book?

answer.para: If this is your first time building LFS, using a version not in the book or varying from the book in any way is not a good idea. The IRC channel regulars have a saying, "FBBG". As Tux, the resident bot, is quick to say, this means, "Follow Book, Book Good." They and the people on the lists have helped many an unhappy newbie who deviated from the book during that first build.
Once you've built a system "by the book", you have a stable knowledge base from which to experiment to your heart's content (or pain, as is often the case.)
To help you on your travails, err travels, here are some notes for specific releases:

listitem.para: flex-2.5.31: This release breaks building modutils, HJ binutils, and XFree86. See for a description of the problem, and for a patch that fixes it.
glibc-2.3.2: Add to your build instructions: touch /etc/ld.so.conf && ln -s /static/bin/pwd /bin/pwd && touch /usr/include/assert.h &&

bash-2.05b: Apply the patches from
and configure bash with --without-bash-malloc.
